SEARCH
Module webfx.stack.com.bus
Package dev.webfx.stack.com.bus

Interface Bus

All Known Implementing Classes:
BusProxy, JsonBus, JsonClientBus, NetworkBus, ReconnectBus, SimpleBus, WebSocketBus
public interface Bus
A distributed lightweight event bus which can encompass multiple machines. The event bus implements publish/register, point to point messaging and request-response messaging.

Messages sent over the event bus are represented by instances of the Message class.

For publish/register, messages can be published to an address using one of the register(java.lang.String, dev.webfx.platform.async.Handler<dev.webfx.stack.com.bus.Message<T>>) methods. An address is a simple String instance.

Handlers are registered against an address. There can be multiple handlers registered against each address, and a particular handler can be registered against multiple addresses. The event bus will route an incoming message to all handlers which are registered against that address.

For point to point messaging, messages can be sent to an address using one of the request(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object, dev.webfx.platform.async.Handler<dev.webfx.platform.async.AsyncResult<dev.webfx.stack.com.bus.Message<T>>>) methods. The messages will be delivered to a single handler, if one is registered on that address. If more than one handler is registered on the same address, the bus will choose one and deliver the message to that. The bus will aim to fairly distribute messages in a round-robin way, but does not guarantee strict round-robin under all circumstances.

The order of messages received by any specific handler from a specific sender should match the order of messages sent from that sender.

When sending a message, a reply handler can be provided. If so, it will be called when the reply from the receiver has been received. Reply messages can also be replied to, etc... ad infinitum

Different event bus instances can be clustered together over a network, to give a single logical event bus.

Author:
田传武 (aka Larry Tin) - author of Goodow realtime-channel project, Bruno Salmon - fork, refactor & update for the webfx project Original Goodow class

    • register

      default <T> Registration register(String address, dev.webfx.platform.async.Handler<Message<T>> handler)
      Registers a handler against the specified address
      Parameters:
      address - The address to register it at

      Returns:
      the handler registration, can be stored in order to unregister the handler later

    • registerLocal

      default <T> Registration registerLocal(String address, dev.webfx.platform.async.Handler<Message<T>> handler)
      Registers a local handler against the specified address. The handler info won't be propagated across the cluster
      Parameters:
      address - The address to register it at
      handler - The handler

    • register

      <T> Registration register(boolean local, String address, dev.webfx.platform.async.Handler<Message<T>> handler)
      Registers a handler against the specified address
      Parameters:
      local - Indicates if the address is local or propagated across the cluster
      address - The address to register it at
      handler - The handler
      Returns:
      the handler registration, can be stored in order to unregister the handler later
